utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 'You've come to Nottingham once too often.'

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: 'After today, there'll be no need for me to come again.'

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You've been holding out on me, Sir Robin. I hear you like a boy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I knew she'd tell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So...who is he?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: His name is Owen. He's in my poetry class. Very shy. And very sweet.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Keep your guard up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Then don't distract me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does he know how you feel about him?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Because I don't even know how I feel about him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes! Very nice!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How many bones did they have to break to get her in there?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Won't know till I get her back to the lab.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Don't contaminate my crime scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry, it must be the feathers.

utterance.speaker: UNIFORM
utterance.content: Beckett's here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No sign of forced entry. The same as the others.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like our home invasion crew went for a four-peat.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They're stepping up their game. Becoming more violent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jinx!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What's wrong with him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Goose down. He's allergic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm sorry. Under the time honored rules jinx, you're not allowed to speak until I release you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Reverse double jinx.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just, I...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh-uh. Castle, mouth shut, until I release you. Thank you, Ryan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do we have?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That's Joanne Delgado, daughter of Susan Delgado, the victim. She called to say good night to her mom, only tonight Mom doesn't pick up. She calls the doorman, doorman comes up, finds the door ajar, and...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, let's just say this one's definitely Beckett-flavored.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Blood spatter indicates single GSW. Close range.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can still smell the cordite.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I'll have to take your word for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, they shot her and stuffed her in the safe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Better than last one. They beat the guy to death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: None of the neighbors heard a gunshot?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nada. Must be heavy sleepers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, they used the pillow as a poor man's sound suppressor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, yes. I broke the jinx. I will buy you a soda.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any shell casings?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: None.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Probably used a revolver.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And a bolt cutter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Her wedding ring. She didn't wanna give it up, and so they punished her for it. Husband?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Passed a few years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In a building like this? This part of town? You'd think she'd be safe. No pun intended. How often are people killed in neighborhoods like this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same as anywhere else, Castle. Just the once.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Each of the robberies took place in a different part of the city.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A different high-end part of the city.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wall safes and high-end jewelry. These guys came in knowing exactly what they were going to find.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there must be a pattern. Something that connects them all. The first one was three months ago?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Central Park West. Bob and Linda Kesler were bound, gagged, and beaten. Intruders wore masks. Took roughly $175,000 in jewelry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Same M.O. on York Street?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Only, when Mr. Bruner refused to open his safe, they broke his wife's arms.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which brings us to last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They're getting bolder. They're escalating their violence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it can't be random. How do they know what's in the safes? "Safes." Is that a word? Is it "saves"? That can't be right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And you write for a living?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. The point?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The point is, our home invaders seem to know an awful lot about their victims.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We've compared insurance companies, home security vendors, even the kinds of safes that they had. Nothing's been a match.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm just thinking, they seem to know their targets so well, maybe they actually know them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe the victim's daughter can tell us.

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: Yeah, we were close. She was my mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you'd know most of her friends?

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: Her friends? Yeah, but I...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were there any that you had a strong feelings about? Didn't like, maybe? Someone she met recently?

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did any of her friends have money problems?

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: Monsters broke into her place and killed her. Why are you asking about her friends?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know Nelson and Janet Bruner?

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about a, uh, Richard and Julie Pastori, or a Bob and Linda Kesler?

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: Who are these people?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They're victims of three previous home invasion robberies - robberies that we think were committed by the same people that murdered your mother.

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: What, there were others? I'm... How long has this been going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A few months.

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: Months? What, and you haven't caught them yet?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They didn't murdered anyone until last week. That's when I got this case, and since then, we've been

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: No, don't press conference me, Detective. All right? I work in public relations. So you can save your speech, because I have heard them all. Alright? I'm the one who drafts all of that pathos after airline crashes and E. coli poisonings. "Our... Our hearts go out to the victims' families." Our hearts? I mean, what does that even mean? She said that she felt like baking. She wanted me to come over, but I was busy. I was busy. And now she's dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Joanne. Listen to me. You're going to want to play out every possible scenario in the next couple of days. If only you'd been there. If only you'd come by. If only you didn't work so late. And I'm telling you, it's not your fault. The ones to blame are the monsters that murdered your mom. This isn't a speech. It's not a platitude. It's a promise. I am going to do everything in my power to make sure that they pay for what they did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pretty impressive, the way you handled her back there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn't "handle" her, Castle. I just told her the truth. Same thing I'm gonna tell the other home

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jinx paid in full.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's the job, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you're short-selling, Beckett. Ryan and Esposito could not manage that level of empathy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's not true. They just they save it for fantasy football trades.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Makes me think about Alexis. What would she do if something happened to me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she still has her mom, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Meredith's more like a crazy aunt with a credit card. Of the two of us, I'm the more responsible

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I wouldn't worry about it too much, Castle. After all, only the good die young.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ouch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, Freud. I know what you're trying to do. You're trying to get me to talk about my mom. See if you can squeeze any more pulp for your fiction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pulp? You think what I do is pulp? Listen, I will have you know that The New York Review of Books - not The New York Times Book Review, mind you, The New York Review of Books - said that Derrick Storm is this generation's answer to--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I read that piece. And even you have to admit that it's more than a little hyperbolic. So how much did you pay the reviewer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A case of Châteauneuf-du-Pape... but that's not the point. The point is, you read the New York Review of Books?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so many layers to the Beckett onion. However will you peel them all?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Esposito, anything from the other victims?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett's downtown finishing the canvass. But what we do know is, the Keslers and the Pastoris didn't know each other, and neither one of them knew the Bruners or Susan Delgado.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well, so much for the personal angle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Four luxury buildings, four major scores, and we got nothing. If I'm these guys, I got no incentive to quit now, either.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, well, whoever they are, they definitely have some righteous trade skills.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: About that... Forensics just came back on the Delgado's place. They found brass shavings in the lock

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Brass shavings?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They used a bump key. Bad guys file down a standard house key, then they use a mallet to drive into

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude, I know what a bump key is.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, you don't.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The hardware on the Delgado's door was a high-end import. No way a standard bump key would work.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. They'd have to use something special. Something your average mope couldn't rig.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: What are you thinking?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, I busted this guy a while back. Specialized in bump keys. And he's not afraid to get a little blood on his paws either.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Bump keys and violence. I like him already.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Evan Mitchell.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Evan Mitchell?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. You know him?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: He's a legacy. His dad and his granddad are legends in the industry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I collared him on a jewel heist out on 47th. He just did a nickel upstate.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: When did Mitchell get out?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Two weeks before our first heist.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Pick him up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Say hello to his little friend.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was in his waistband when we snatched him up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Serial numbers are scratched off.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Heavy on collars, light on convictions.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Amazing how many times a guy can get arrested without ever serving time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He must have a pretty good lawyer.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Or good at what he does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good enough to be our perp?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why do you writers always call them perps?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn't that what you call them?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, we got a whole lot of names for them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pipehead, pisshead, ork, creep.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Crook, knucklehead, chucklehead.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Chud, turd.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Destro, skell.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Skeksi, slicko, slick.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mope.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sleestak.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Slow down, slow down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Suspects. We call them suspects.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I'm old school. I like "dirtbag."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Classic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell me about the gun, Mr. Mitchell.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Oh, I'm not talking without a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why? You guilty of something?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Yeah. Not running fast enough when your boys showed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between five and nine?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: I didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn't do what?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Doesn't matter what. Wherever you think I was, I wasn't.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So where were you, then?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Happy hour. Little neighborhood place. Drinking Belfast Carbombs with some of my Westie pals.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got anyone that can verify that for me?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Yeah, I got about 30 people or so who can - conservative estimate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How come I got this crazy hunch that most of those people got records a lot like yours?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Well, I wasn't drinking tea at The Plaza. Look, you want more reliable witnesses? Give me an hour or so. I'll see what I can do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You must be pretty well connected. Friends in high places.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Who's Mary with the manicure? I know he's not a cop. Not with that haircut.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm assisting Detective Beckett in the investigation.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Assisting? What's the matter, sweetie? You can't hack it out there alone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want to play?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let's play. I got an ex-con with a gun and two fresh homicides just looking for a home.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: You can fish all you want, Detective. Smart fish don't bite.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: We can hold him on the gun, but there's no match with ballistics on Mrs. Delgado. And without other

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'll find something, sir.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Not if his alibi checks out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, it's just pots and kettles.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: On the last robbery, not the first. Mitchell was being arraigned on an unrelated burglary the same day this crew struck. Unless you can break his alibi on this one, he's a dead end.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got to watch those silhouettes. They can be shifty little bastards.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you mind? I'm trying to concentrate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Man, when I hit a wall, all I got is one of those little stress balls and internet porn.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I get it, all right? You made a promise to a daughter to find her mother's killer. Doesn't take Freud

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, as much as I appreciate your folksy Dr. Phil aphorisms, I just want to--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wouldn't it be more of a challenge if they weren't standing still?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Castle. You show me how it's done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's not a duel, Scaramouche. Here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Square off to target. Feet shoulder-distance apart. Okay-

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gauntlet your right fist in your left palm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa! Shot too soon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well. You know, we could always just cuddle, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, funny. And a smile. Good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Photos of the jewelry? Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don't know. Just thought it might spark something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. That gotta hurt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell you what. You put any of the next three in the 10-ring, and I will give you the files.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're a very good teacher.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. How was your date with Owen?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, it wasn't a date. It was a study group.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, how many in the group?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Just the two of us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Pilfering evidence again, I see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Borrowing. And these are just copies. Insurance companies like to maintain photos of pieces like these for identification in case anything gets lost or stolen.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Hello, gorgeous. Ooh. Where have you been all my life?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I'm thinking of installing a new security system. Maybe even a panic room.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Panic room? What for? Panic attacks?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Anyone comes, we'll beat them off with swords. Or pens, since they are mightier.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I'm serious. I just want us to be safe.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, life isn't safe. Especially not in New York. Cranes collapse, air conditioners fall out of the sky. In the end, there's just a few short years. The most you can do is make the most of it before something knocks you down. "People living deeply have no fear of death."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anaïs Nin? Mother, how many of those have you had?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, shh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are pretty incredible pieces. You wouldn't use a normal fence for these. You'd need someone with impeccable taste, someone who appreciated their value, someone who had high-end buyer connections...

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Powell. Oh, now there was a man. And you had to ruin it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Who's Powell?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was years ago. I'm sure he's forgotten all about that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Who's Powell?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Forgotten? You forced him into retirement. You ruined his life. He threatened to slit your throat.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad! Who's Powell?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You remember that character of mine, um, Bentley Silver?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The jewel thief in Storm Rising?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I kind of based him on Powell.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Kind of? You stole the man's entire life. And then your father, genius that he is, thanked him in the acknowledgements, completely blowing his cover.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he can't still be mad. I'm gonna go see him.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I'll be okay. Don't worry. I think it'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: If he doesn't slit your throat, tell him he owes me an evening at Le Cirque.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad? Dad...

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: I've been waiting a long time for this, Castle.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: What can I say, Rick. You really had it coming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I did. Thanks for not killing me.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: The carpet's an antique. Turkish, mid 1600s. Blood stain on it would've been a disaster. Besides, I was ready to retire. Being a ghost is a young man's game.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good to see you again, old friend.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: And you as well, dear boy. Tell me, how is Martha?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still a one-woman-show in search of an audience. She says you owe her an evening at Le Cirque.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: And to what do I owe the pleasure? You're not planning a sequel, I hope.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: What's this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stolen jewelry from that rash of home invasions.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Whew. So very lovely.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was wondering if anyone's tried to fence them.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: I've heard nary a whisper of anything in this range.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The police are holding a guy named Mitchell.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Haven't had the pleasure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything special about these? Anything they have in common?

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: These are hardly everyday wear. I suppose one dusts them off for that very special occasion.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then, how did our thieves know they were there?

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Seeing comes before wanting, Rick. These chaps may actually live among their victims and move through their world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything else special about them?

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Without seeing the scene of the crime, anything more would be mere speculation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the crime scene's all locked and sealed. I don't think I could get you in there.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Let that be the least of our concerns.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You, uh, don't seem out of practice.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Just like riding a bike.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our thieves used a bump key.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: This new generation. How utterly vulgar.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Rick. You didn't tell me they put her in the safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What's the significance?

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: The significance is it's ...unnecessary. It's brutality for brutality's sake. This used to be a gentlemen's game. We were like ghosts. We could walk through walls and simply disappear. But whoever did this, they're more like vampires. Taste of the blood makes them feel alive. These aren't the sort of chaps a fellow in my line of work would care to meet by chance in the dark.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How often does that happen?

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: More often than you'd think, actually. Ours is a very small community.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then what?

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: In my day, we'd usually come to some sort of an agreement. You see, there was a Code of Conduct among professionals.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Powell? Powell?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. What's going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You brought a thief to a crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was very helpful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was criminal trespassing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To-may-to, to-mah-to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell your friend to keep up his disappearing act. And the next time you show up at a crime scene without me, I'll show you how my taser works.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Promise? So, why were you there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seeing if there's anything I missed. So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did Mitchell make bail yet?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paperwork's not done yet. I'm holding him out of spite.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I want to talk to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why? We already know he wasn't involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something Powell said. I think Mitchell knows more than he's saying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what makes you think he'll share it with us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not us. Just me.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: So what are you, a forensic psychiatrist? Some kind of profiler?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I'm a writer.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Embedded reporter, huh? What, you gonna make me famous?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not that kind of writer. I'm a novelist.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Yeah? Anything that, uh, I might have heard of?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh... Storm's Last Stand? Storm Season?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Derrick Storm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: I love that guy. Why the hell did you kill him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's a long story. But I'm working on a new one and I gotta tell you, it is very cool. But I want to get the details right.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: They never get the details right. Not in books, movies. They always write us as clowns and thugs. They never stop to think that maybe we got mortgages, families...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Okay, so, in the new book, it's about this crew of home invaders, based on the crew we're looking for right now. I got this one scene where a guy just like you runs into these guys by accident. In the middle of a job.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Wouldn't happen to me. I'm not doing residentials. Not at least until you catch these guys. These guys are dark.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, you know them?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Their shot caller came into the bar a few months back, looking to put together a crew. Wanted to bring me on. Said he had eyes inside, working up scores for him, feeding him the Glengarry leads, items, names, addresses. Said that all he needed was one of my bump keys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you give it to him?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Yeah, I gave it to him. But just to get rid of him. I wasn't about to join his crew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'll be damned.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: Like I said, these guys were dark.

utterance.speaker: MITCHELL
utterance.content: And I'm a two-minute man. In and out. That's my one hard-and-fast. But this sadistic whack job? Whoa. Said he liked to play with his food before he ate it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. All right, this, um... This shot caller, if I put him in the book, I want it to feel authentic. How would you describe him?

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: This is the man who killed her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We think so. We believe he may have had more than just a passing relationship with your mom, and he could be anyone. A waiter. Dog-walker. Doorman. Personal trainer.

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: No. I don't recognize him. Maybe one of the other victims knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your mom wear jewelry often?

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: No. Just to special events.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of special events?

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: A fashion show last year. Gallery openings. Fundraisers. My mother loved her causes. Opera

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eyes inside.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why are we doing this, again?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, according to Mitchell, the shot caller who wanted the bump key had someone feeding him inside information about our victims.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Powell says the pieces of jewelry being stolen are the kind you save for special occasions.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Special occasion like a charity event.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So we find an organization that all of our victims supported...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ...and we find our guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Delgado and Pastori both gave to the Manhattan Opera Society.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But not the last two victims.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I got three families that donated to AIDS America: Delgado, Bruner, and Kesler.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But not Pastori.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe Pastori was a guest of one of the other three victims?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-mmm. No. None of the families knew each other.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a second. M.A.D.T. That's the Metropolitan American Dance Theater.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Metropolitan American Dance Theater.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Metro American Dance.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: M.A.D.T.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's the non-profit our invaders are profiting from.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Find out who's in charge and how I can find them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There she is. Anne Greene, company's director.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She can invade my home any time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, if she's in on it, she's doing it purely for kicks. Textile heiress. No record and clean DMV.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: White centerpieces go on the Angel Tables. Red centerpieces go on Sponsor Tables.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Greene, I'm Detective Beckett and this is--

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: Ricky? Ricky Castle? I've heard perfectly awful things about you from my friend Cheney.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: Tall, brunette, after-market nose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheney! Of course! How is Cheney?

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: Oh, I hear she's a great scandal in San Moritz.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: And you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Currently between scandals, actually.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: Oh. You two aren't...?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Never. In fact, um, Ricky here is assisting me with a homicide investigation.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: How exciting.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. And it involves your organization.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: All of our employees go through an extensive background check. I can assure you, none of them are

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'll still gonna need a list of the employees who had access to donor records.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: Of course... Detective, I'm sure this is all a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unfortunately, I'm not. And that's why I'm gonna need a copy of your donor list as well.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: That may be a problem. The people who give publicly, they're not an issue. But some of our donors cherish their anonymity. We're contractually obligated to protect that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about their lives? Do your donors cherish those as well?

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: I assure you, my office will contact each of them and alert them to the situation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'd really like to contact them myself.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Detective, but my hands are tied. If you want my confidential donor list, you're gonna need a court order.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Awkward.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We ran employees and volunteers. None have priors or records.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hello?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What's she doing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Writing an affidavit for a court order.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That no one is going to sign. Did you see that list of Board members? Half the judges in town are on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What am I supposed to do? Just let someone else die?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, hey, you seem a little stressed. Hey, you know what you need?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A night out on the town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A what now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are those?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The gateway to another world.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They hold four fundraisers a year. The last one took place a week before the robberies began.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is perfect. You don't have to ask who the donors are, because they'll be there wearing their jewelry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If the employees and volunteers are clean, then our perp...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Skell.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: ...could be working the party.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And we can work the door.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, it's settled. Pick me up at eight? Oh, it's a black tie event. That's not a problem, is it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no... No.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No, no. Uh-uh. That one goes to the thrift store.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Whoa, "Karma Chameleon".

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The girl at Saks said fluorescent is in.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well then, she was on commission.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Uh-uh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Too Showgirls?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what he's trying to do? He wants to humiliate me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, can you get that, please?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: All right. But you better not be wearing your prom dress when I get back.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: My dad, nervous for a date?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's not a date. It's an undercover operation.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Would you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I don't know why you won't tell me where the party is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because you'll show up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was it?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Delivery.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From who?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Let's find out.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Bibbity-bobbity-boo?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cinderella. It's from him.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Oh, please. It's a dress. Now open it up, girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh! I knew he was arrogant, but this, this is complete...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Stunning. Simply stunning. Come in, come in. Oh! Hang on. Hang on.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You look incredible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really. You clean up nice, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Castle.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I was nominated for a, uh, Tony once, and...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no, Martha, I couldn't--

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes, you can. Let me... Oh! It's brilliant. So, where are you guys headed tonight?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh... Uh... Uh, we're going to the, uh, Waldorf.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Man, these guys look guilty of tax evasion, not home invasion.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, well...appearances can be deceiving.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nice dress.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, what there is of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'd let you borrow it, Esposito, but you stretched out the last one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Big cheese!

utterance.speaker: MAYOR
utterance.content: Ricky! Ricky! Hey! Why didn't you tell me you were gonna be at this shindig? I would've given you a ride.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, last minute thing. Listen, Mr. Mayor, I'd like to present to you Detective Kate Beckett. Kate Beckett, you know the Mayor.

utterance.speaker: MAYOR
utterance.content: So this is Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It's an honor to meet you, sir.

utterance.speaker: MAYOR
utterance.content: Oh, please. Call me Bob. Rick, she's even prettier than you said.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: MAYOR
utterance.content: Excuse me a minute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You talk about me to "Bob?"

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I get you a drink?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Vodka... lots of vodka. But I'm on duty, so water.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Vodka.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could I get two very stiff vodka martinis? Don't shake them, just swirl them around a bit.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Coming right up.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Richard. Hi, Rachel Maddox. We spoke on the phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, and thank you very much for getting me the tickets.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Thanks for the signed first edition for the auction.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I had my eye on it, but it's probably too rich for my blood.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh! My boyfriend, Paul Reynolds. He is a huge fan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, always nice to meet a fan.

utterance.speaker: RUTHIE
utterance.content: Don't sweat it. That's just Rachel, Anne's Head of Development. She's only after his money - so to speak.

utterance.speaker: RUTHIE
utterance.content: Oh, I'm Ruthie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, Beck... I'm Kate. Nice to meet you. Do you work for the charity?

utterance.speaker: RUTHIE
utterance.content: No. No. But I am on the circuit. You know, breast cancer, land mines. Oh, you know what the best one is? Um, uh, that project what do you call it - the one with the lips? There are a lot of, uh, plastic surgeons there. Fish in a barrel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: RUTHIE
utterance.content: Mmm. Oh! Not that you need any help from me. I see you've got a big one on the line. Settle in, Katie. I hear he's a fighter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um... Sorry, Castle?

utterance.speaker: RUTHIE
utterance.content: Oh, most of the girls on the register have tried to land him. Rich and handsome. We call him The White

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Listen, we're having a little gathering next month for our top donors. We're going to unveil plans for a new rehearsal space. If you're free, we'd love for you and Alexis to come.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know my daughter?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: We make a point to know as much as we can about our potential donors, so we can match their interests with our programs. So many places just ask you to just write a check. We want you to know that your money is making a difference.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Would you excuse me just for a second?

utterance.speaker: RUTHIE
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So creepy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Negative on anyone matching our sketch. How are we doing on vendors and staff?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No red flags yet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, so what's it like in there? Is it a buffet or passed hors d'oeuvres?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Both. Hey have you seen, uh...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry, this is the only place I knew we could talk and not be overheard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was just talking to the Head of Donor Development over there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She seems to know an awful lot about me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She's not the only one. Did you know that they call you the White Whale?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The White Whale?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not Moby--

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. She's in Donor Development. It's her job to know about you. Besides, she doesn't strike me as a criminal mastermind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still, I think we should take a second look. Two, three, dip...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? A little help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's Powell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The jewel thief?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don't believe this. The two of you are in on it?

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: Don't look at me. It was his idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You really had me going, didn't you? The wine, the cheese, the Code of Conduct. And here you are, making me look the fool.

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: I just wanted to have a bit of fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fun? You call what you're doing fun?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what's going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They're in on it together. They've all but admitted it.

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: I'm so sorry. I had no idea it was such a big deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Big d...? Two people are dead!

utterance.speaker: ANNE
utterance.content: Dead? What's he talking about?

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Good lord, Rick. You didn't think...?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then... what were you two whispering about?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Thank you all for coming tonight. And now it's time for all of us to open our hearts as we auction off some of the city's finest items for one of the finest causes. To start the bidding, please welcome Martha Rodgers!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What have you done?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Thank you...

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Just a little payback.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Thank you for that warm welcome. The first item on our list is a signed first edition of Storm Season, written by, well, by my son. There he is.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Wave, darling, so everyone one can see you. Oh, isn't he handsome? My still single son, ladies. So, as a special bonus, the winning bidder will also receive an enchanting evening in his company. All right, ladies, that's the best I can do. The rest is up to you. Do we have an opening bid?

utterance.speaker: RUTHIE
utterance.content: Twenty-five hundred!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: 2,500, beautiful lady in blue. Thank you so much. Do we hear 3,000? 3,000? Girls, don't be shy. We have a gentleman bidder. Oh, and isn't he attractive?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, my goodness! Aren't we broad-minded?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, there we have it. 4,000. All right, ladies. The gauntlet is down. And this is the most...

utterance.speaker: POWELL
utterance.content: Now we're even.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: ...intelligent and charming man...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, I have money. Anything you pay, I'll pay you back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, not a chance in hell, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, whoa, look. There's donor girl's boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, he's taking pictures.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So? I would, too, if I had a camera.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of the crowd?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: $7,000. Oh! Going once, going twice, sold for $7,000!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Reynolds. Paul Reynolds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's perfect. He IDs the jewels and then uses his girlfriend's research to build profiles on the victims.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Yahtzee. Paul Reynolds, AKA Chad Nellis. He's served on check fraud, embezzlement, forgery, and grand larceny.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Now, it does no good to be coy. I've seen the looks you've been throwing me all night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shopping, are we?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paul Reynolds, you're under arrest on suspicion of theft and conspiracy to commit murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let's go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where was the badge?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don't ask.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, B_E, firearms. Definitely a step up for this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He's just a foot soldier. We're looking for his general.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened to the dress?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn't think I was going to interrogate him in it, did you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We were kind of hoping.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Out of my chair, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you know him?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: We met in Green Haven Prison. A guy like me? You know they would've eaten me alive in there. But he looked out for me in the yard. They-- they were all afraid of him. Even the guards. And when he got out, he found me. I don't know how.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it was his idea to infiltrate the charity?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I was already seeing Rachel at the time. I mean, I was trying to go straight. But he said that I owed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And so you just fed him all the top donors.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Everything he needed was already in their dossiers: names, addresses. I took photographs of all their jewelry and put it all on a flash drive. But he wanted more and more. Detective, after he beat that guy to death, I told him I wanted out, but he said that if I quit, that he'd do everything he saved me from in prison. He'd do it to me and Rachel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then tell me where I can find him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, as a friend, I am asking you not to leave this car. Because your little Hardy Boy act--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: -is gonna get me killed, I know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: More like get one of them killed and I can't have that on my conscience. Understood?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if I have to pee?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go, go, go!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD! We have a warrant!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look, his coffee. It's still warm. Must have just missed him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like we got the right place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Police! Police!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop! Police!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Follow him out back!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ...Pum-num-nah-nah-nah-num-nah-nah. Pum-num-nah-nah nah-nAAH. De-nah-num-nah -NAAAH.

utterance.speaker: NADIR
utterance.content: Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: NADIR
utterance.content: Out of the car!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I... She told me, actually, I have to stay in the...

utterance.speaker: NADIR
utterance.content: Out of the car now!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay! Okay, okay! Here I come. I'm coming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go ahead. I need the practice.

utterance.speaker: NADIR
utterance.content: Ow. Ow. Ah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We got him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Get up!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I tried to stay in the car. I really did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He hit me in the face, you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I saw that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That, uh, "Go ahead. I need the practice." That was classic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pum-num-nah-nah-nah-num-nah-nah. Pum-num-nah-nah...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The other pieces are still in evidence, but I didn't see the harm in returning ...this.

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: How do you get over it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don't. But one day you'll wake up and you'll find that you don't mind carrying it around with you. At least, that's as far as I've come.

utterance.speaker: JOANNE
utterance.content: Thank you, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My name's Kate. If you ever need to talk.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Darling, we have a visitor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, pretty butch, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, right? Come, grab a chair.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no. I just came to return your mom's jewel--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You saved my life. The least I can do is make you some eggs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, really, I-- I have to get going...

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Nonsense. You sit down right here. Tell us all about last night. We've only heard his version.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Um... Shall I begin at the red carpet?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yes, please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, we came in...
